channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024020860
item.description:
Report X-2024020860

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package came down from vanline#735 visibly wet. Upon further inspection, the package has a cracked plastic jug on the sides with nutrients solution which caused internal leaking and damages DescribePack: cracks on the sides DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill pads and spill totes

item.title: Report X-2024020965
item.description:
Report X-2024020965

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH discovered package on parked van during van unload. PH alerted management that solid granules were leaking out of hazmat package. Operations were halted in the area. DescribePack: Large crack on bottom seam of plastic drum caused granules to leak into and out of outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in a red hazmat tote. Spilled granules were contained using a brush and dust pan.
